text: is a railway station located in the city of Neyagawa, Osaka Prefecture, Japan. One notable feature of this station is that it has a large tree growing in the middle of it. The station was built around it. The tree is estimated to be around 700 years old; its base has become a small shinto shrine.Aaron Netsky, Kayashima Station, Atlas Obscura (Accessed March 15 2017) ==Lines== * Keihan Electric Railway ** Keihan Main Line ==Adjacent stations== == Notes == Category:Railway stations in Osaka Prefecture Category:Shinto shrines
title: Kayashima Station
